title: Mandated vs. Voluntary Adaptation to Natural Disasters: The Case of U.S. Wildfires
text: NBER Working Paper

title: The Economic Incidence of Wildfire Suppression in the United States
text:
Abstract





This study measures the degree to which public expenditures on wildfire protection subsidize development in harm’s way. We use administrative data on firefighting expenditures to measure the causal effect of nearby homes on the amount spent to extinguish wildfires. We use these estimates in an actuarial calculation yielding geographically-differentiated expected implicit subsidies for homes across the Western U.S. The expected net present value of this subsidy can exceed 20% of home value, increases with fire hazard, and decreases surprisingly steeply with development density. We discuss potential behavioral responses by individuals and local governments using a simple economic model.

title: UBC Environmental Data Science Lab
text:
The UBC Environmental Data Science Lab (EDSL) is a collegial research group based out of the University of British Columbia.
Our projects ask how climate and related environmental hazards impact people, and how people can better respond to them.
We (do our best to) answer these questions using the tools of applied economics and data science.

title: UBC Environmental Data Science Lab
text:
Mission
The first mission of the group is to provide a community and a shared set of resources for community members UBC interested in questions about how people and the environment interact.
The second mission is to more precisely define the first mission.
(It’s a work in progress y’all.)

title: Resource
text:
R Packages

ROpenSci Universe: The ROpenSci list of packages includes many that facilitate access to interesting datasets.
Programming

skimr: Quick summary statistics.
charlatan: Make fake data, e.g., names.
bibtex: Parse a .bib file. (Might be useful for this website. There are other related packages, e.g., handlr.)
parzer: Parse messy latitudes and longitudes.

Weather

weathercan: R package to get ECCC weather data.
GSODR: One of a few packages for downloading Global Summary of the Day weather data.
rnoaa: Client for many NOAA data sources.
stationaRy: Hourly weather data from around the world.
prism: Access prism data.
Chirps and Chirts: Global reanalysis weather data, 1983-2016.

Disasters

rrricanes: Hurricane data since 1998.

Pollution

epair: Help with parsing various EPA datasets.

Imagery

rsat: Search, download, and process satellite imagery from several free sources.
rnaturalearth: Natural earth imagery for mapping.

Transport

bikedata: Public bicycle data.

Spatial

geonames: Access geonames.org API to get geography names.
